intro: Lindernia syncerus, commonly known as the narrowleaf lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, blooming from summer to fall. Lindernia syncerus thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
